text: when President Obama made his historic
visit to Vietnam last month human rights
were an important item on his agenda it
was also an opportunity but those few
who dare to challenge the Communist
Party to have their voices heard and
perhaps to meet mr. Obama but the
Vietnamese authorities in the end made
very few concessions to their famous
American guests only one single
political prisoner was released in
advance of mr. Obama's arrival when he
tried to meet some of those dissidents
well a number of them were barred from
going to that meeting for foreign
journalists like us when we were there
it is extremely difficult to get to meet
or talk to any dissident figures but we
have managed to speak to one woman one
of six who were detained at the time a
woman called Nancy neuen now she'd flown
to Vietnam from the United States where
her family settled 16 years ago to show
her dissatisfaction with the government
she was held for a week and then
expelled we spoke to her enroute back
home to the United States they just came
to my hotels at well 11:00 at night and
temporarily just capture me without
having any no warrant or nothing it's
just like kidnapping well that's nothing
really I can go there it can do that was
about ten of them that just won me I
know I knew ahead of time that I won't
be arrested so my plan actually it's
just trying to make that make use of
that and make the most out of it
basically it's a it's a bilateral kind
of relationship where they interrogate
me and at the same time they kind of
have to feed me with informations in
order to make me talk oh there was
polite to me in terms of physically
abuses there wasn't any but you know
they give you a lot of warning say you
know don't even expect any health on the
outside or even expect any help from the
government the yes Lola man no ones can
do anything you are here with us now and
just you and ice us and you're the only
person who can help you out if you're
not going to cooperate and you progress
to here forever and if you cooperate
you're going to be out here then
tomorrow
Mansingh urines ordeal was not
particularly heavy and she knows it
could have been a whole lot worse had
she not been an American citizen among
the dozens of political prisoners being
held in jail in Vietnam some are serving
sentences of many years
